projects.name: Flower Embellishments

steps.instruction: Trace all the pieces of the template and position them image side down on the coloured card. Rub over the pattern with a pencil to transfer the image onto the card.
steps.visual_description: Image 1 shows a hand holding a pencil and tracing a flower template onto a piece of orange cardstock. Several other pieces of cardstock with traced flower outlines are visible in the background.

steps.instruction: Carefully score along any dotted lines and cut out any solid lines with scissors or a scalpel. Repeat this until you've cut and scored all the pieces of the template.
steps.visual_description: Image 2 shows a hand using a ruler and a craft tool (possibly a scalpel or scoring tool) to score along a dotted line on an orange piece of cardstock. The cardstock has a flower outline traced on it.

steps.instruction: The four central flowers that need to be assembled are made in pairs. Fold along the score marks and overlap the first and seventh petals to make a cone shape, using tape to secure. Fold in half as shown on the orange flower.
steps.visual_description: Image 3 shows a hand holding a partially assembled flower made of orange cardstock. The petals are folded to form a cone shape. Another orange petal is being held to overlap with the existing ones.

steps.instruction: Stick double-sided tape to two petals and attach a different coloured flower, leaving one petal unattached at either end. You should end up with a shape that is four petals wide and only attached at the middle two petals.
steps.visual_description: Image 4 shows a hand attaching a yellow petal to an orange petal with double-sided tape. A pink petal is also visible, suggesting the assembly of a layered flower. The text indicates that two sets of these flowers are needed.

tips: You will need two sets of these flowers.
projects.finished_product_description: Layered paper flowers made from cardstock.

templates.name: Flower Template
templates.shape_description: A template for cutting out flower shapes from cardstock. The template includes solid lines for cutting and dotted lines for scoring.

diagram_descriptions: Image 1: A close-up of hands tracing a flower template onto colored cardstock with a pencil. Several other traced flower shapes are visible.
Image 2: A close-up of hands using a ruler and a craft knife or scoring tool to score along a dotted line on a piece of cardstock with a flower outline.
Image 3: A close-up of hands assembling a paper flower by folding and overlapping petals, securing with tape.
Image 4: A close-up of hands attaching petals of different colored paper flowers together using double-sided tape.

projects.name: Pop-Up Bouquet

steps.instruction: Fold the small pink central flower that is scored in three places and stick one side on the card at the angle pictured above. Peel the backing off the tape on the top edge and fold the card in half so the other half sticks in the right position.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown holding a small pink flower with three scored folds. One side of the flower is being adhered to a card. The card is then folded in half.

steps.instruction: Using the double-sided tape or a little glue, stick a dot in the middle of the central flower so it sits on either side of the fold. Then stick coloured dots in the middle of all the remaining flowers.
steps.visual_description: Several paper flowers of different colors and sizes are shown on a light-colored surface. A hand is placing a small orange dot onto the center of a pink flower. Text indicates that scored flowers need dots as well.

steps.instruction: Fold and position one side of the green leaf as shown. It's crucial that the point of the crease is in the gutter and the top edge is 4cm (11/2in) from the gutter. Apply tape to the top and close the card so the other side sticks in the correct spot.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown holding a green paper leaf. A ruler is placed against the leaf, indicating a measurement. The leaf is being folded and positioned. Text indicates to align with the gutter.

steps.instruction: Stick the two flowers that have nine petals in position on either side of the central folded flower. Then stick the two large flowers that have six petals to the top edge of the green leaf - one on either side.
steps.visual_description: A partially assembled pop-up bouquet is shown. A hand is placing a pink flower with six petals onto a green leaf. Other flowers are already in place.

projects.finished_product_description: A pop-up bouquet made of paper flowers.

diagram_descriptions: The page is divided into four main sections, each with a number (5, 6, 7, 8) indicating a step in the project. Section 5 shows a hand folding and sticking a small pink flower onto a card. Section 6 shows various paper flowers and a hand adding small colored dots to their centers. Section 7 shows a hand measuring a green paper leaf with a ruler and indicating a fold. Section 8 shows a hand attaching a flower to the green leaf as part of the bouquet assembly. The title 'POP-UP BOUQUET' is at the top right with a small icon. The page number '17' is at the bottom right.

projects.name: Pop-Up Flower Card

steps.instruction: Stick the grass on this petal.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of a pink paper flower petal with a green paper grass blade being adhered to its back. A dotted line indicates where the grass should be placed.

steps.instruction: Position the central flowers into the crease in the middle as shown. There should only be tape on the bottom petal.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown positioning a cluster of colorful paper flowers into a crease. The flowers are pink, orange, and yellow. The background is a light green textured paper.

steps.instruction: Stick the other half of the flower to the other side of the card, but this time add tape to just the top petal. Stick on the remaining central flowers in the same way. This will ensure the flower pops out properly.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown adhering a pink paper flower to the side of a card. The text indicates this step ensures the flower pops out properly.

steps.instruction: Stick the two medium-sized flowers with score lines on either side of the fold. Then add the little red flower above them, and the little pink one below.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of colorful paper flowers being adhered to a card. Two medium-sized flowers are placed on either side of a fold, with a small red flower above and a small pink flower below.

projects.finished_product_description: A pop-up card featuring colorful paper flowers.

projects.name: Envelope

steps.instruction: On the back of the paper, draw along the two diagonals to mark the centre.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a pencil and ruler, drawing a diagonal line on the back of a piece of paper. The paper is folded into a triangle shape, and the ruler is positioned to draw a line from one corner to the opposite edge, intersecting the center. A ruler with markings is visible, showing numbers 9, 10, and 11.

steps.instruction: Fold two opposite corners into the centre, then fold and unfold a third corner.
steps.visual_description: A hand folding two opposite corners of a patterned paper towards the center. The paper is laid flat on a blue wooden surface. The pattern consists of colorful circles in pink, orange, green, and teal.

steps.instruction: Turn the paper and fold the last corner so it lines up with the pencil and fold line.
steps.visual_description: A hand folding the last corner of the patterned paper. The paper is partially folded, and the corner is being aligned with a previously drawn pencil line. The pattern of colorful circles is visible on the folded section.

steps.instruction: Unfold the previous fold and align the point with the new fold line as shown.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of the folded patterned paper. A dotted line indicates a new fold line. A hand is shown aligning a point of the paper with this dotted line. The previous fold is partially unfolded. The colorful circle pattern is visible.

projects.finished_product_description: A partially formed envelope made from patterned paper.

diagram_descriptions: The page displays four sequential images illustrating the process of making an envelope from a piece of patterned paper. Image 1 shows marking the center by drawing diagonals. Image 2 shows folding two opposite corners to the center. Image 3 shows folding the last corner to align with a line. Image 4 shows unfolding and aligning a point with a new fold line.

projects.name: DIY Envelopes

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom corners so the edges run along the horizontal fold lines.
steps.visual_description: Hands folding the bottom corners of a patterned paper square inwards so that the edges align with horizontal crease lines.

steps.instruction: Pull out the point at the bottom and push the diagonal folds underneath to create a tongue.
steps.visual_description: A finger is pulling out the bottom point of the folded paper, and another finger is pushing the diagonal folds inward to form a flap or tongue. Dotted lines indicate the path of the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the tongue over and tuck into the middle.
steps.visual_description: Hands are folding the created tongue flap downwards and tucking it into the center of the envelope structure.

steps.instruction: Place your note inside and seal with a sticker, tape, glue, or wax.
steps.visual_description: A completed patterned paper envelope is shown, ready to be sealed. The top flap is closed, and the bottom has been tucked in.

projects.name: Gifts to Give

steps.instruction: Using a pencil, transfer the template to tracing paper and turn it over. Lay it on top of your card and rub over the tracing with pencil to transfer the image onto the card.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a pencil over a piece of paper with a template on it, showing a ruler in the background.

steps.instruction: Using a fresh blade, carefully start cutting the smaller, fiddly areas of the picture such as the eyes, arms, and the inside of the ears. Use small cuts for the curves.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a craft knife, cutting small details on a paper with a drawing of rabbits and flowers. The text indicates to use small cuts for curves.

steps.instruction: Take your time to ensure the cuts are neat. Working in a clockwise direction, cut one side of each petal at the bottom towards the centre of each flower. Then cut the other side of each petal working in the other direction.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a craft knife, cutting small star shapes on a paper. The text describes cutting flower petals in a specific direction.

steps.instruction: Turn the image upside down and cut out the grass. When this is complete, carefully cut away the remaining paper between the rabbits.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a craft knife, cutting out grass shapes from a paper. The image shows several cut-out grass elements and rabbits in the background.

tips: Use small cuts for the curves.
Take your time to ensure the cuts are neat.
Cut away from the joins to avoid over cutting.

tools.name: craft knife
tools.purpose: cutting intricate details and tidying snagged areas

steps.instruction: Working around the edges, begin to cut away the rest of the image. Take your time, especially with smaller areas such as the stars and leaves.
steps.visual_description: A close-up photo of a hand holding a silver craft knife, carefully cutting out intricate details like stars and leaf-like shapes from a white paper design on a grey cutting mat. The design shows outlines of a moon and clouds.

steps.instruction: Once you have finished cutting all of the image away, flip the card over and go back over any snagged areas to tidy them up.
steps.visual_description: A close-up photo of a hand holding a silver craft knife, refining the edges of a fully cut-out paper design. The design features silhouettes of rabbits, trees, stars, and a moon, lying on a grey cutting mat. Small cut-out paper pieces are scattered around.

steps.instruction: Measure the size of the glass in your frame and cut the image, acetate, and background card to this size. Use the glass to ensure the image is central to the markings.

The hand is positioning the clear sheet over the design.

steps.instruction: Place the glass and image in the frame, followed by the acetate. Add the frame insert and lay the background card on top before affixing the back of the frame in place.
steps.visual_description: A photo showing hands assembling a white picture frame. A clear sheet (glass or acetate) is being carefully placed over the cut-out paper design, which is already inside the frame. The frame has small black flexible tabs to secure the layers.

tips: Take your time, especially with smaller areas such as the stars and leaves.
Go back over any snagged areas to tidy them up after cutting.
Use the glass from your frame to ensure the image is central to the markings when cutting other layers.

projects.name: Papercut locket

materials.dimensions: small enough to fit in locket/keyring

steps.instruction: Measure the interior of the locket to ensure the papercut design will fit.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a metal ruler over an open octagonal locket frame with a chain. The ruler shows measurements in both inches and centimeters.

steps.instruction: Apply repositionable glue to the back of the papercut design, ensuring it doesn't smear the glass.
steps.visual_description: A hand applying glue to the back of a small, intricate white papercut butterfly using a white glue pen/applicator. An open octagonal locket frame is visible in the background.

tips: With a little creativity, patience, and a very steady hand, you can adapt the same technique used for the nursery papercut to make something small enough to fit in a locket or a keyring.
Make sure the design can fit inside the locket.
Use a repositionable glue so it doesn't smear the glass.
Almost any simple shape will work, but as the papercut needs to be small, choose something without too much detail or it will be very hard to cut neatly.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half diagonally, then unfold and fold along the other diagonal.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of green paper is shown. It has been folded in half diagonally and unfolded, creating a crease. The instruction indicates to also fold along the other diagonal.

steps.instruction: Fold in half horizontally, then unfold and fold again.
steps.visual_description: The same square piece of green paper is shown. It has been folded in half horizontally and unfolded, creating a horizontal crease. The instruction indicates to also fold it again (presumably vertically).

tips: Depending how strong your LED lights are, you may need to experiment with a variety of paper opacity to get the right look.

steps.instruction: Fold the front edges inward as shown, then repeat on the back.
steps.visual_description: A green paper object, likely the diamond shape from step 5, with the front edges being folded inwards towards the center.

projects.name: Accordion Folded Paper Decorations

tools.name: ruler
tools.purpose: guiding scoring tool for straight lines

tools.name: cutting mat
tools.purpose: protecting work surface and providing guides for straight lines

tools.name: craft knife
tools.purpose: cutting shapes into folds for detail

steps.instruction: Score equally-spaced vertical lines on several sheets of paper. Use the guides on your cutting mat to ensure the lines are straight. The more sheets used and the wider the lines, the bigger the fan will be.
steps.visual_description: A close-up photo shows a hand holding a scoring tool and a ruler, scoring vertical lines onto a pink sheet of paper placed on a grey cutting mat with grid markings.

steps.instruction: Apply PVA glue to the bottom segment of one sheet of paper. Stick the top segment of another sheet of paper on top so they overlap. Allow to dry and then repeat this process with the other sheets (minimum of two sheets).
steps.visual_description: A close-up photo shows a hand holding a pink sheet of paper, applying a line of white PVA glue with a small brush along its bottom edge. A small clear bowl of glue is visible in the background.

steps.instruction: Fold the glued papers along the scored creases to create an accordion effect.
steps.visual_description: A close-up photo shows hands folding a stack of pink paper sheets along the previously scored lines, creating an accordion-pleated stack.

steps.instruction: Repeat the scoring, gluing, and folding process with slimmer sheets of paper of a different colour. When done, lay them flat and cut shapes into the folds to add detail.
steps.visual_description: A photo shows a partially unfolded accordion-pleated piece of yellow paper with a floral pattern, lying flat on a grey cutting mat. The paper has small triangular shapes cut out along its edges. An orange utility knife is next to it, and small paper scraps are scattered around.

tips: The more sheets of paper you use and the wider the scored lines, the bigger the fan will be.
projects.finished_product_description: Accordion-folded paper decorations, possibly fans or rosettes, with cut-out details along the folds.

diagram_descriptions: Image 1 shows a hand scoring vertical lines on pink paper with a ruler and scoring tool on a cutting mat.
Image 2 shows a hand applying PVA glue to the bottom edge of a pink paper sheet with a brush.
Image 3 shows hands folding a stack of pink paper sheets into an accordion shape.
Image 4 shows a yellow patterned accordion-folded paper with cut-out details, lying flat on a cutting mat next to a utility knife.

projects.name: Hanging Fan

steps.instruction: Repeat again with another thinner paper. However, instead of cutting a design in the folds, slice the ends off diagonally.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of hands folding and cutting teal paper with a floral pattern. The paper is folded into pleats, and the ends are being cut diagonally with scissors.

steps.instruction: Use a glue stick to attach the second paper to the first and allow to dry. Then apply glue to the bottom of the third.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of hands using a glue stick to attach a second pleated paper strip (yellow with floral pattern) to a previously glued strip. The strips are arranged in a fan shape.

steps.instruction: Glue the third paper along the bottom edge of the fan. Take your time to ensure the edges align properly.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of hands gluing a third pleated paper strip (teal with floral pattern) to the bottom edge of a fan made of folded paper strips. The fingers are shown aligning the edges.

tips: Make sure to glue firmly.
projects.finished_product_description: A decorative hanging fan made of folded and glued paper strips in alternating patterns.

projects.name: Hanging Fan

steps.instruction: Turn the fan on its back and stick the plain disc to the centre with hot glue. Fold a ribbon in half, place the opposite ends on top, then stick the second disc on top with more hot glue.
steps.visual_description: Hands are shown attaching a plain disc to the center of a pink folded paper fan using hot glue. A folded ribbon is placed on top of the plain disc, and a second patterned disc is being placed on top of the ribbon and plain disc.

steps.instruction: Lay the folded ribbon between one of the fan's folds, then secure in place with a strip of paper and some PVA glue.
steps.visual_description: Hands are shown inserting a folded ribbon into a fold of the pink paper fan. A strip of paper is being used to secure the ribbon with PVA glue.

steps.instruction: Cover the hole on the front of your fan with buttons or beads.

projects.name: Paper Ball Decorations

steps.instruction: Use a punch to cut out circles. You will need six per ball.
steps.visual_description: A hand is using a purple punch to cut out circles from patterned paper. Several cut-out circles are visible.

steps.instruction: Fold the circles in half, image sides together.
steps.visual_description: Hands are folding cut-out circles in half. Some circles are plain, and one has a floral pattern. A finished blue paper ball is visible in the foreground.

steps.instruction: Begin gluing the folded circles on top of each other.
steps.visual_description: A hand is applying glue from a glue stick to a folded paper circle. Another folded circle is being placed on top. A partially assembled paper ball is visible.

steps.instruction: Repeat until all the folded circles are glued together.
steps.visual_description: A hand is gluing the last folded paper circle onto a partially assembled paper ball. The paper ball is being formed on a flat surface.

tips: Use a punch for clean holes

projects.name: Hanging Garlands

steps.instruction: Make two knots on a length of string and glue it between the circles. Close the circles around the string and glue in place.
steps.visual_description: A hand is holding a blue string with two knots tied in it. The string is positioned between two folded paper circles, which are being held closed around the string.

steps.instruction: Apply a little glue to the end of the string to stop it from fraying.
steps.visual_description: A paintbrush with white glue on its bristles is touching the end of a blue string.

steps.instruction: Thread beads onto the string and make a loop at the end.
steps.visual_description: A hand is threading blue and yellow beads onto a blue string. A loop is being formed at the end of the string.

steps.instruction: Repeat the steps to make more balls for your garland.
steps.visual_description: Several colorful paper balls, strung together with beads, are shown. Some balls are fully formed, while others are partially visible.

steps.instruction: Pull the string to close the loop and secure the beads.
steps.visual_description: A hand is pulling a blue string to tighten a loop, securing beads that have been threaded onto it.

projects.finished_product_description: A garland made of colorful, folded paper balls and beads strung on a blue string.

projects.name: Paper Feather Headdress

materials.color: red, orange, yellow, light blue, teal, dark blue, white

steps.instruction: Cut out feather shapes from construction paper. Each feather should be approximately 6 inches long and 1.5 inches wide at its widest point, tapering to a point. Cut small slits along the sides of each feather to create a fringed effect.
steps.visual_description: Various colorful paper shapes resembling feathers with fringed edges.

steps.instruction: Take the white cardstock strip and form it into a headband. Overlap the ends by about 1 inch and secure with a glue stick.
steps.visual_description: A white paper strip formed into a circular headband.

steps.instruction: Arrange the paper feathers around the outside of the headband, overlapping them slightly. Start with the longer feathers in the back and shorter ones in the front. Secure each feather with a glue stick.
steps.visual_description: Colorful paper feathers attached in a fan-like arrangement to the white headband.

tips: Use different patterns and colors of paper for a more vibrant headdress.
Adjust the size of the headband to fit the wearer's head.

steps.instruction: Fold the tail along the top towards the head.

steps.instruction: To make the eyes, glue on two paper circles made by a hole punch and colour in each centre.
steps.visual_description: A finished origami bird is shown standing on a circular base. Two small paper circles are glued onto the head to represent eyes, with colored centers. Green paper leaves are placed around the bird.

projects.name: Making the owls

steps.instruction: Fold a sheet of paper in half inward. Trace all the pieces of the template.
steps.visual_description: Hands folding a sheet of paper with a geometric pattern (purple and green cubes) along the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Place the owl's body face down on the folded paper. Rub to transfer.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a green pencil, tracing a template onto folded paper. The template shows an outline of an owl's body and two circles for eyes.

steps.instruction: Cut out the eyes and bodies to make two halves of your owl.
steps.visual_description: A hand using a craft knife to cut out two oval shapes from paper, which are the eyes of the owl. The paper has a geometric pattern.

steps.instruction: Transfer and cut out all the other template pieces.

steps.instruction: Cut "U" shapes into the breast to make feathers.
steps.visual_description: A hand using scissors to cut U-shaped notches into a pink circular piece of paper.

steps.instruction: Gently fold and push out the feathers.
steps.visual_description: A pink circular piece of paper with U-shaped notches, where the notches are gently pushed outwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the top and glue on a coloured triangle for a beak.
steps.visual_description: A piece of patterned paper folded at the top, with a blue triangle glued on to form a beak.

steps.instruction: Glue the breast, being careful not to stick the feathers down. Repeat for the owl's other half.
steps.visual_description: A pink circular piece of paper with feathers is being glued onto a patterned paper base, with the feathers slightly raised.

steps.instruction: Stick thin strips of double-sided tape above and below the eyes, then stretch a piece of cotton thread between them.

steps.instruction: Tape a 40cm (15in) piece of dark thread to the centre of the owl (but not the beak). Then stick or glue the two halves together.

steps.visual_description: Close-up of an owl's face made of paper, showing purple and green geometric shapes for feathers. Four small circles are being glued near the eyes, and a beak is being attached with a sticky pad.

projects.name: Paper Crown

steps.instruction: Trace the templates and lay them face down on card. Rub with a pencil to transfer the image.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a piece of paper with drawn templates over a blue cutting mat. The paper is being rubbed with a pencil to transfer the design.

steps.instruction: Cut out the shapes with a scalpel, using a ruler to make sure the cuts are straight.
steps.visual_description: Hands using a scalpel and a ruler to cut out shapes from a piece of grey cardstock on a blue cutting mat. Several cut-out shapes are visible.

steps.instruction: Apply glue to the points of the crown.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a brush, applying glue from a small glass bowl to the pointed edges of a cut-out paper shape on a blue cutting mat.

steps.instruction: Stick the other card on top so the two pieces properly align.
steps.visual_description: Two cut-out paper shapes, one on top of the other, on a blue cutting mat. The pointed edges are aligned, suggesting they are being joined.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper crown with cut-out decorative shapes.

diagram_descriptions: A circular icon with a paintbrush and palette, next to the text 'KIDS' CRAFTS'.

projects.name: PARTY CROWN

materials.dimensions: to the circumference of the child's head

steps.instruction: When dry, stick down the rest of the crown.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a brush applying glue to a light blue cutting mat, with a silver cut-out crown piece partially adhered. Another hand is pressing down on a section of the crown.

steps.instruction: Cut a length of string to the circumference of the child's head. Lay it across the strap so one end touches the edge of the card. Place a sticky pad at the other end of the string.
steps.visual_description: A hand pointing to a long, silver strip of card (the strap) with a piece of string laid across it. A pair of blue-handled scissors is visible in the background.

steps.instruction: Peel the back off the sticky pad and stick down the strap.
steps.visual_description: A hand peeling the protective backing off a small, white sticky pad that is attached to the end of a silver-colored strap.

steps.instruction: Trim and neaten any overhang or rough edges.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of the assembled silver party crown, showing its spiky top edge and cut-out diamond and triangular shapes along its body, resting on a light wooden surface.

pieces.name: crown_base
pieces.shape: strip with cut-out points and internal shapes

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Form the strip into a circular crown shape, securing with string and sticky pad.

tips: Trim and neaten any overhang or rough edges.
projects.finished_product_description: A silver party crown with a spiky top edge and decorative diamond and triangular cut-outs along its body.

diagram_descriptions: Image 5: A hand applying glue with a brush to a silver cut-out crown piece on a blue cutting mat, with another hand holding down part of the crown.
Image 6: A hand pointing to a long, silver strip of card with a piece of string laid across it, next to a pair of blue-handled scissors.
Image 7: A hand peeling the backing off a small, white sticky pad attached to the end of a silver-colored strap.
Image 8: A close-up of the assembled silver party crown, featuring a spiky top edge and diamond and triangular cut-outs, resting on a light surface.

projects.name: Paper Daffodils

steps.instruction: Cut 6 petals from yellow crepe paper, 2in x 3in each. Cut 6 petals from white crepe paper, 2in x 3in each. Cut 6 trumpet shapes from orange crepe paper, 1.5in x 2in each. Cut 12 leaves from green crepe paper, 1in x 4in each.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing shapes of petals, trumpets, and leaves to be cut from crepe paper.

steps.instruction: Gently stretch the center of each petal and trumpet to create a cupped shape. Curl the edges of the petals outward.
steps.visual_description: Illustration showing how to cup and curl the edges of paper petals and trumpets.

steps.instruction: Glue 3 yellow petals and 3 white petals around one end of a 20-gauge wire. Then, glue an orange trumpet shape in the center of the petals.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the assembly of a daffodil flower head with petals and trumpet glued to a wire.

steps.instruction: Wrap the wire stem with green floral tape. Attach 2 green leaves to the stem, wrapping with floral tape.
steps.visual_description: Illustration showing leaves being attached to the floral-taped stem.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 1-4 to create 6 daffodil flowers.
steps.visual_description: Image showing 6 completed paper daffodils.

steps.instruction: Arrange the daffodils on a sheet of brown kraft paper, wrapping the paper around the stems. Tie the stems together with ribbon.
steps.visual_description: Photograph of a bouquet of paper daffodils arranged on brown kraft paper and tied with ribbon.

tips: Use a light touch when stretching the crepe paper to avoid tearing.
projects.finished_product_description: A bouquet of handmade paper daffodils with yellow, white, and orange flowers, green stems and leaves, presented on brown kraft paper and tied with silver ribbon.

diagram_descriptions: Photograph of a bouquet of handmade paper daffodils arranged on brown kraft paper and tied with a silver ribbon. The daffodils have yellow and white petals with orange centers and green stems and leaves. The background is a textured grey surface.

A page with a light blue background, featuring several delicate branches with paper flowers in shades of pink and orange. The flowers appear to be made from tissue paper or crepe paper, with some having a darker pink center. The branches are thin and brown, with some small buds visible. The overall arrangement resembles cherry blossoms or plum blossoms. In the bottom left corner, the number '96' is visible.

projects.name: Cherry Blossom
projects.finished_product_description: A paper version of cherry blossoms made from crepe paper and attached to dry branches.

The materials include rolls of crepe paper in pink, magenta, and orange; a small square of light gray card; a pink hot glue gun with a glue stick; a bottle of gold glue; a pencil; and two pairs of scissors. projects.name: Paper Flowers

steps.instruction: Trace the templates and place upside down on card. Rub with a pencil to transfer.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a pencil over a template on a grey cardstock, with a square shape traced onto the cardstock.

steps.instruction: Cut out the petals. You will need five for each blossom.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding scissors cutting pink tissue paper into petal shapes.

steps.instruction: Gently stretch the centre papers between your fingers.
steps.visual_description: A hand gently stretching the center of a pink paper strip between two fingers.

steps.instruction: Fringe the centre papers finely, about 1cm (1/4in) deep. Roll the centres between your fingers and glue the opposite ends.
steps.visual_description: Two images. The top image shows a hand fringing the center of a pink paper strip with scissors. The bottom image shows a hand rolling the fringed center of the paper strip and applying glue to the opposite end.

projects.finished_product_description: Pink paper flowers attached to thin branches.

templates.name: Flower Petal Template
templates.shape_description: A square template used for tracing petal shapes onto cardstock.

diagram_descriptions: A page showing instructions for making paper flowers, with four numbered steps illustrated by photographs. The bottom of the page displays a finished product of several pink paper flowers on branches.
A small pink flower icon next to the word 'FLOWERS'.

projects.name: Cherry Blossom

steps.instruction: Cup the petals between your fingers to shape them.
steps.visual_description: Hands cupping pink paper petals to give them a curved shape.

steps.instruction: Glue the petals around the centre at the bottom of the fringing, overlapping halfway across each petal.
steps.visual_description: Pink paper petals being glued around a central fringed area, with petals overlapping.

steps.instruction: Once dry, cut the stems to 0.5cm (1/4in).
steps.visual_description: A pink paper blossom with a stem, next to scissors and a small pink cylinder representing the cut stem.

steps.instruction: Hot glue onto the branch at the point you wish. Try gluing the blossoms in clusters for a realistic look.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a pink paper blossom and attaching it to a brown branch with hot glue.

projects.finished_product_description: A craft project creating cherry blossoms on a branch.

diagram_descriptions: A decorative title 'CHERRY BLOSSOM' with a small pink flower icon.
A branch with several pink cherry blossoms attached, against a light blue background. The page number '99' is in the bottom right corner.
A bouquet of paper daffodils, some white with orange centers, others yellow with orange centers, arranged on a piece of brown paper with a grey ribbon tied around it.

projects.name: Daffodil
projects.finished_product_description: Bright and cheerful daffodils made from crepe paper.

diagram_descriptions: A collection of craft supplies laid out on a textured surface, including bottles of glue and spray mount, a spool of green wire, a watercolor paint palette with a paintbrush, a yellow pencil, a metal ruler, stacks of colored crepe paper (yellow, white, orange, light green, dark green), a pair of pliers, a pair of scissors, a piece of tracing paper on top of a brown scrap surface. Labels point to most of the items.

projects.name: Crepe Paper Flowers

steps.instruction: Place florist's wire at one end of a small piece of fringed crepe paper. Add glue and roll the paper around the wire.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a florist's wire with a small piece of yellow, fringed crepe paper at the end, being rolled around the wire.

steps.instruction: Cut orange paper for the trumpet and brush the edge with red paint.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a piece of orange crepe paper, with a paint brush applying red paint to the edge. A palette with red and yellow paint is visible.

steps.instruction: Lightly spray some spray mount over a sheet of crepe paper. Cut out six petals for each flower.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a spray can, spraying a sheet of yellow crepe paper. The paper is laid out flat.

steps.instruction: Pinch the top of the petal until it forms a realistic shape.
steps.visual_description: Two yellow crepe paper petals are shown. A dotted line indicates pinching the top of one petal to create a shape.

steps.instruction: Once dry, wrap the trumpet around the stamens and secure with wire.
steps.visual_description: An orange crepe paper trumpet shape is shown wrapped around some stamens, with a wire securing it.

steps.instruction: Shape the petals with your thumbs.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of yellow crepe paper petals being shaped by thumbs.

projects.finished_product_description: A handmade flower with crepe paper petals and an orange trumpet-like center.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps for making crepe paper flowers, numbered 1 through 4, with additional steps described in text.
A small pink icon with a flower shape next to the word 'FLOWERS'.

projects.name: Daffodil

steps.instruction: With your finger and thumb, gently stretch the trumpet part of the flower.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding an orange paper trumpet shape and gently stretching its opening with a thumb and finger.

steps.instruction: Arrange the petals around the stem. Wrap strips of green paper diagonally around the stem to hold in place.
steps.visual_description: A yellow paper daffodil flower with an orange trumpet, being assembled. A hand is wrapping a strip of green paper around the stem below the petals.

steps.instruction: Add some green leaves to the stem; glue and hold in place with strips of paper.
steps.visual_description: A hand is attaching green paper leaves to the stem of the daffodil with glue and small strips of paper.

steps.instruction: Glue between the trumpet and the petals.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of the daffodil flower head, showing a glue applicator being used to glue the base of the trumpet to the petals.

tips: Squeeze gently into shape.
projects.finished_product_description: A handmade daffodil flower made from paper.

diagram_descriptions: The page is divided into four quadrants, each showing a step in making a paper daffodil. The top left shows step 5, the top right shows step 6, the bottom left shows step 7, and the bottom right shows step 8. The title 'DAFFODIL' with a small flower icon is at the top right. The page number '103' is at the bottom right.

projects.name: Large rose
projects.finished_product_description: Perfect for a wedding or birthday party, these giant roses will create a real talking point. The dramatic and delicate petals makes them look stunning and appealing.

diagram_descriptions: A collection of craft supplies laid out on a white wooden surface, including rolls of pink and teal crepe paper, a wooden dowelling rod, a bundle of green florist wire, a yellow pencil, a pair of scissors, a roll of green stem tape, and a pink hot glue gun with a black cord.

projects.name: Crepe Paper Flowers

materials.quantity: six small, ten medium, and six large petals

steps.instruction: Copy the templates to cardboard and cut them out. Draw around them and cut out six small, ten medium, and six large petals from pink crepe paper. Then cut eight sepals and one large leaf from dark green crepe paper.
steps.visual_description: Hands holding a pencil and a cardboard template over pink crepe paper, with dotted lines indicating where to cut.

steps.instruction: Put two small petals to one side, then use a pencil to curl the tips of the remaining petals. Stretch the paper slightly as you roll it. For the large petals, roll each lobe separately.
steps.visual_description: Hands holding pink crepe paper petals and a pencil, demonstrating how to curl the edges.

steps.instruction: Push your thumbs into the centre of the small petals to cup them. Push out the medium and large petals in the same way, but this time at three points on the petal.
steps.visual_description: Hands cupping and shaping pink crepe paper petals.

steps.instruction: Add a dab of hot glue to the bottom point of the two small, uncurled petals and attach them to the dowelling. Apply glue to the top of the rod and roll the petals into a spiral around it.
steps.visual_description: A pink hot glue gun applying glue to a wooden dowel, with pink crepe paper petals being attached.

projects.finished_product_description: Crepe paper flowers with sepals and leaves.

templates.name: Petal and Leaf Templates
templates.shape_description: Templates for small, medium, and large petals, sepals, and a large leaf. Specific shapes are not detailed but are implied to be drawn onto cardboard.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: Shows hands holding a pencil and a cardboard template to trace petal shapes onto pink crepe paper. A dotted line indicates the cutting path.
Diagram 2: Shows hands using a pencil to curl the edges of pink crepe paper petals, with an instruction to stretch the paper slightly.
Diagram 3: Shows hands cupping and shaping pink crepe paper petals by pushing thumbs into the center.
Diagram 4: Shows a pink hot glue gun applying glue to a wooden dowel, with pink crepe paper petals being attached and rolled around it.

projects.name: Large Rose

steps.instruction: Going from small to large, attach the remaining petals in the same way, spacing by eye. Add glue further up the petal to keep the shape if need be. You also may have to stretch the base of the large petals to fit.
steps.visual_description: A hand attaching a large pink crepe paper petal to a partially formed rose bud, with the petal being curved and glued at its base.

steps.instruction: For the sepals, slightly stretch the bottom of each one so that they fit around the base of the flower head. Then curl the points and glue them on, ensuring that some of the paper attaches to the dowelling.
steps.visual_description: Hands attaching dark green sepals to the base of a pink rose. The sepals are slightly stretched and curled at the tips.

steps.instruction: Place a line of hot glue along the centre of the large green leaf and attach the floral wire. Fold the leaf in half and allow the hot glue to set before opening again.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a pink hot glue gun, applying glue to a large, dark green paper leaf. A floral wire is positioned along the center of the leaf.

steps.instruction: Starting at the base of the rose, wind the stem tape around the dowelling. After a few turns, add the wired leaf, and glue it in place with the glue gun. Continue to wrap the stem tape around the dowelling until you reach the end.
steps.visual_description: Hands wrapping dark green stem tape around a wooden dowel. A wired leaf is being attached to the dowel with glue.

projects.finished_product_description: A large, detailed paper rose with sepals and a wired leaf attached to the stem.

diagram_descriptions: Top left: A close-up of a large, pink crepe paper rose bud, showing the tightly curled center petals.
Top right: A close-up of hands attaching dark green sepals to the base of a pink rose. The sepals are slightly stretched and curled at the tips.
Bottom left: A close-up of a hand holding a pink hot glue gun, applying glue to a large, dark green paper leaf. A floral wire is positioned along the center of the leaf.
Bottom right: Hands wrapping dark green stem tape around a wooden dowel. A wired leaf is being attached to the dowel with glue.

A collection of six origami flowers of various colors and patterns, attached to bare branches in a vase. The flowers are in shades of pink, yellow, teal, and orange. Some have polka dot patterns, while others have intricate geometric or floral designs. The page number '108' is visible in the bottom left corner.

projects.name: Kusudama
projects.finished_product_description: Beautiful origami flowers that can be used to decorate a room or be stuck to almost anything with glue.

diagram_descriptions: A pile of folded squares of patterned paper in yellow, orange, blue, and pink, fanned out. A tube of glue with a red cap is visible at the bottom right.
A close-up of patterned paper squares, some with polka dots, some with geometric patterns, and some with peacock feather designs.
A close-up of a tube of glue with a red cap, resting on patterned paper.

projects.name: Origami Flower

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of pink paper with a peacock feather pattern.

steps.instruction: Fold into a triangle.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of patterned paper folded into a triangle.

steps.instruction: Fold both the bottom corners up to the middle.
steps.visual_description: A triangle with the bottom corners folded up to meet at the center line, creating a kite-like shape.

steps.instruction: Poke a finger inside each flap to pop them out, then flatten along the seam to create two kite shapes.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape with two flaps being opened and flattened to form kite shapes.

steps.instruction: Fold the points back so they line up with the outside edges.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape with points being folded back to align with the outer edges.

tips: Choose your paper colour. You'll need five squares per flower.
projects.finished_product_description: A collection of colorful origami flowers.

diagram_descriptions: A page showing the steps to create an origami flower. The steps are numbered 1 through 4, with accompanying diagrams and text instructions. The page also features a title 'FLOWERS' and the page number '110'. At the bottom of the page, several finished origami flowers in red, yellow, and blue are displayed.

projects.name: Kusudama Flower Petal

steps.instruction: Fold the top triangle of the kite shapes flat so they are level with the long edge behind.
steps.visual_description: A pink and gold patterned paper folded into a kite shape. The top triangle is being folded down to be level with the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides in to create a square shape.
steps.visual_description: The kite shape from step 5 is further folded by bringing the sides inwards to form a square.

steps.instruction: Bring the two sides together to create a petal. Glue in place.
steps.visual_description: Hands are holding the folded paper from step 6 and bringing the two open sides together to form a petal shape. Glue is being applied to the seam.

steps.instruction: Repeat until you have five petals, then glue them together along the join one at a time.
steps.visual_description: Several kusudama petals are shown. One petal is being held and glued to another petal along its side seam. The image implies that five petals will be joined to form a flower.

projects.finished_product_description: A kusudama flower made of five folded paper petals.

diagram_descriptions: A collection of finished kusudama flowers in various colors (blue, orange, yellow, pink) and patterns, displayed on a light background.
The number '111' is present in the bottom right corner, indicating the page number.

projects.name: Boutonniere

steps.instruction: Cut a length of ribbon and tie it around the stem of a flower.
steps.visual_description: A cream ranunculus flower with a pale pink ribbon tied around its stem.

steps.instruction: Attach the flower stem to the back of a cardstock tag using hot glue.
steps.visual_description: A cream ranunculus flower attached to the back of a kraft cardstock tag.

steps.instruction: Thread twine through the hole of the tag and tie a loop.
steps.visual_description: A kraft cardstock tag with a cream ranunculus flower attached, and twine threaded through the hole to form a loop.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 1-3 for the remaining flowers and tags.
steps.visual_description: Six cream ranunculus flowers attached to kraft cardstock tags, each with a twine loop.

steps.instruction: Arrange the finished boutonnieres on a dark surface.
steps.visual_description: Six finished boutonnieres arranged in a 3x2 grid on a dark slate surface, with a spool of pale pink ribbon and pins scattered around.

projects.finished_product_description: A set of six boutonnieres, each featuring a cream ranunculus flower attached to a kraft cardstock tag with a twine loop, and a pale pink ribbon tied around the flower stem.

diagram_descriptions: A flat lay of six finished boutonnieres arranged on a dark slate board. Each boutonniere consists of a cream ranunculus flower attached to a kraft paper tag, with a twine loop threaded through the tag's hole. A pale pink ribbon is tied around the stem of each flower. A spool of pale pink ribbon and several silver-headed pins are scattered on the slate board around the boutonnieres.

projects.name: Crepe Paper Flowers

steps.instruction: Cut three leaves from green crepe paper and snip the edges to create a serrated effect.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding scissors cutting the edge of a green crepe paper leaf to create a serrated edge.

steps.instruction: Wrap the base of the leaves around the end of a length of floral wire and glue in place.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a length of floral wire with the base of three green crepe paper leaves wrapped around the end, secured with glue.

steps.instruction: Position the leaves at the base of the flower's head. Hold both wires together, and wrap them with a long strip of green crepe paper.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a white flower head and positioning green crepe paper leaves at its base, with wires held together and being wrapped with a strip of green crepe paper.

steps.instruction: Cut the stem about 4cm (1½in) from the flower head using pliers.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding pliers cutting the stem of a white flower with green leaves attached.

projects.finished_product_description: A handmade crepe paper flower with green leaves on a stem.

diagram_descriptions: A page from a craft book titled 'FLOWERS' with four numbered steps for making crepe paper flowers.

projects.name: Buttonhole Flower

steps.instruction: Wrap green paper around the end of the stem to neaten.
steps.visual_description: A white paper flower with green leaves on a stem. A piece of green paper is being wrapped around the bottom of the stem.

steps.instruction: Tie a length of ribbon around the top of the stem.
steps.visual_description: A white paper flower with green leaves on a stem. A pink ribbon is being tied around the top of the stem, just below the flower head.

steps.instruction: Wrap the ribbon around the stem from top to bottom, then wrap it back up to the top.
steps.visual_description: Hands are shown wrapping a pink ribbon around the stem of a white paper flower. The ribbon is being wrapped downwards and then upwards.

steps.instruction: Tie off again at the base of the flower head and cut away excess ribbon.
steps.visual_description: Hands are shown tying off the pink ribbon at the base of the flower head. Excess ribbon is being cut away.

projects.finished_product_description: A delicate white paper flower with green leaves, attached to a stem wrapped with pink ribbon, suitable for a buttonhole.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 5 shows wrapping green paper around the stem of a paper flower.
Diagram 6 shows tying a pink ribbon around the top of the stem of a paper flower.
Diagram 7 shows wrapping a pink ribbon around the stem of a paper flower from top to bottom and back up.
Diagram 8 shows tying off the ribbon at the base of the flower head and cutting excess ribbon.

projects.name: Paper Flower Wreath
projects.finished_product_description: A circular wreath adorned with various handmade paper flowers in shades of pink, peach, and yellow, along with green leaves, all set against a light blue wooden background.

diagram_descriptions: A circular wreath made of handmade paper flowers and green leaves, displayed on a light blue wooden surface. The flowers include large ruffled blooms in pink and peach, smaller white daisies with yellow centers, and yellow daffodils. The leaves are elongated and textured.

projects.name: Festival headband
tips: Most combinations of bright flowers will work well.
projects.finished_product_description: A headband adorned with various bright paper flowers, including peonies, daffodils, and daisies, suitable for festivals, weddings, and springtime events.

diagram_descriptions: Photo of a finished flower headband worn by a person with brown hair, viewed from the side, showing a mix of pink, orange, yellow, and white flowers.

Flat lay photo of all required materials and tools on a white wooden surface, including various paper flowers (small and large peonies, daffodils, daisies), florist wire, crepe paper, tracing paper, ruler, scissors, pliers, pencil, spray mount, glue, and a scrap surface.

projects.name: Flowers

steps.instruction: Wrap two 36cm (14 1/4in) strips of 20-gauge wire in 1.5cm (5/8in) wide crepe paper, overlapping the ends of the wire by 7.5cm (3in).
steps.visual_description: Two green wires being wrapped with a strip of green crepe paper, with the ends of the wire overlapping.

steps.instruction: Use crepe paper to secure the join.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown securing the join of the wire with crepe paper.

steps.instruction: Spray mount two shades of green crepe paper together. Cut out 25 leaves and pinch to shape.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown pinching a cut-out green crepe paper leaf to give it shape.

steps.instruction: Make five stems with five leaves on each. Wrap a 6cm (2 1/2in) length of 20-gauge wire with a 1.5cm (5/8in) wide strip of crepe paper, tucking and gluing in the leaves between wraps.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown wrapping a short piece of wire with crepe paper, and tucking green leaves into the wrap.

tips: Measure your head with the wire, holding the point at which the two ends need to overlap. Glue in place.
projects.finished_product_description: Flowers made from crepe paper leaves and wire stems.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1 shows two 36cm (14 1/4in) strips of 20-gauge wire being wrapped with 1.5cm (5/8in) wide green crepe paper, with the ends of the wire overlapping by 7.5cm (3in).
Diagram 2 shows a hand securing the join of the wire with crepe paper.
Diagram 3 shows a hand pinching a cut-out green crepe paper leaf to give it shape.

Diagram 4 shows a hand wrapping a 6cm (2 1/2in) length of 20-gauge wire with a 1.5cm (5/8in) wide strip of green crepe paper, tucking and gluing green leaves into the wrap to create a stem with leaves.

projects.name: Festival Headband

steps.instruction: Attach the leaf stems to the ring using 26-gauge wire. Keep the ends of the wire away from the inside of the ring. Trim the stems if necessary.
steps.visual_description: A close-up photo of hands attaching green leaf stems to a circular base ring using thin silver 26-gauge wire. The ring is partially covered with green material, and the leaves are also green.

steps.instruction: Space the leaves out evenly, facing towards a focal point at the front of the ring. Leave a large gap at the back.
steps.visual_description: A top-down view of a completed section of the headband ring, which is covered with green leaves. The leaves are arranged evenly and point towards a central area, with a noticeable gap at the opposite side (back).

steps.instruction: Attach the flowers using 26-gauge wire. Place a large peony at the focal point and space the other flowers around the headband.
steps.visual_description: A close-up photo of hands attaching a large, light pink paper peony flower to the green-covered headband ring. Green leaf stems are already attached to the ring, and thin silver 26-gauge wire is being used for the attachment.

steps.instruction: Wrap the ring of wire in strips of green crepe paper. This will cover up any bits of wire and strengthen the ring.
steps.visual_description: A close-up photo of hands wrapping a strip of green crepe paper around the headband ring. The ring already has some green material and wire wrapped around it, and the new crepe paper strip is being tightly wound to cover and reinforce it.

tips: Keep the ends of the wire away from the inside of the ring.
Trim the stems if necessary.
Wrapping with crepe paper will cover up any bits of wire and strengthen the ring.

projects.name: Bunting

steps.instruction: Fold a paper diamond in half and add double-sided tape.
steps.visual_description: Photo of a hand holding a light blue paper diamond folded in half, with a strip of double-sided tape applied to one half. Other pastel colored paper diamonds are visible in the background.

steps.instruction: Unpeel the tape's backing.
steps.visual_description: Photo of a hand peeling the backing off the double-sided tape on a light blue paper diamond. Other pastel colored paper diamonds and string are visible.

steps.instruction: Close the diamond over a length of string to make the bunting.
steps.visual_description: Photo of a hand pressing together the folded light blue paper diamond, enclosing a piece of string. Several finished bunting flags are visible on the string.

tips: If there is a lot of blank space left on your pages, try adding decorative elements such as bunting, ribbon, or these little paper bows. They can help to fill the space without making your pages look too cluttered.
projects.finished_product_description: Paper diamonds folded over a string to create a decorative bunting.

projects.name: Bows

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram of a square with diagonal fold lines and horizontal/vertical fold lines indicated by dashed lines.

steps.instruction: Fold the corners to the center.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram of a square with its four corners folded inwards to meet at the center, forming a smaller square.

steps.instruction: Pull the sides into the middle, then pull down the top to close.
steps.visual_description: Two line diagrams. The first shows the folded square from step 2 with arrows indicating pulling the sides towards the center. The second shows the resulting shape, a smaller square with a top flap folded down.

steps.instruction: Open out and invert the folds.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram showing the previous shape being opened out, with arrows indicating how to invert the folds at the corners.

steps.instruction: Fold in. Repeat on back.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram showing the shape with the top and bottom points folded inwards. Arrows indicate repeating the fold on the back.

steps.instruction: Cut along the dotted lines.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram showing the folded shape with two dotted lines indicating where to cut on the top section.

steps.instruction: Observe the front and back of the folded shape.
steps.visual_description: Two line diagrams labeled 'Front' and 'Back', showing the appearance of the folded paper from both sides after the previous steps.

steps.instruction: Perform a fold as indicated.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram showing the shape with an arrow indicating a fold on one of the side flaps.

steps.instruction: Result of the fold.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram showing the shape after the fold from step 8 has been completed, creating a more defined central section.

steps.instruction: Cut along dotted line.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram showing the shape with a dotted line on the bottom central flap, indicating where to cut.

steps.instruction: Perform a fold as indicated.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram showing the shape with arrows indicating a fold on the two side flaps, folding them inwards.

steps.instruction: Result of the fold.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram showing the shape after the fold from step 11 has been completed, further shaping the bow.

steps.instruction: Observe the current bow shape.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram showing the partially formed bow with two loops and a central pleated section.

steps.instruction: Turn over and cut off the ends.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram showing the bow shape turned over, with dotted lines indicating where to cut off the pointed ends of the 'ribbons'.

steps.instruction: Fold into the middle.
steps.visual_description: Line diagram showing the bow with the cut ends folded inwards towards the middle, completing the bow shape.

tips: If there is a lot of blank space left on your pages, try adding decorative elements such as bunting, ribbon, or these little paper bows. They can help to fill the space without making your pages look too cluttered.

projects.name: Heart box

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper folded with diagonal creases.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed diagonal lines forming a grid of triangles.

steps.instruction: Turn the paper over.
steps.visual_description: The same square paper as step 1, but flipped over. The diagonal creases are now valleys.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom corner up to the center, and then fold the two side corners to meet at the center.
steps.visual_description: The paper is folded from step 2. The bottom corner is folded up to the center. The left and right corners are folded inwards to meet at the center line.

steps.instruction: Fold the top flap down.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 3 is shown. The top triangular flap is folded down over the previously folded sections.

steps.instruction: Fold the two side flaps inwards to create the sides of the box.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 4 is shown. The two side flaps are folded inwards, creating the sides of a box shape.

steps.instruction: Fold the remaining top flaps down to form the lid.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 5 is shown. The remaining top flaps are folded down, forming the lid of the box.

steps.instruction: Tuck the flaps into the pockets to secure the box.
steps.visual_description: The box from step 6 is shown. The flaps are being tucked into the pockets to close the box.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half lengthwise.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular piece of paper is shown, folded in half lengthwise with dashed lines indicating further folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides inwards to create the shape.
steps.visual_description: The folded paper from step 8 is shown. The sides are being folded inwards, creating a more complex shape with multiple layers.

steps.instruction: Fold the corners inwards.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 9 is shown. The corners are being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the flaps upwards.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 10 is shown. The flaps are being folded upwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half again.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 11 is shown. It is folded in half again.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides inwards.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular shape is shown, with two vertical panels on each side, folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the top flaps down.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 13 is shown. The top flaps are folded down.

tips: Repeat steps 8-12 on the other side.
projects.finished_product_description: A heart-shaped box.

projects.name: Basic rosette

steps.instruction: Draw and score a grid on a 20x8cm (8x3in) piece of paper. Each section of the grid should be 1x4cm (1/2x1 1/2in).
steps.visual_description: A hand using a pencil and ruler to score a grid on a piece of paper. The grid lines are spaced 1cm apart.

steps.instruction: Cut the paper in half lengthwise, then fold each scored line like an accordion.
steps.visual_description: A hand folding a piece of paper along scored lines to create an accordion fold. The paper is folded lengthwise.

steps.instruction: Attach the ends of the two lengths of folded paper with double-sided tape to form a circle.
steps.visual_description: A hand attaching the ends of a folded paper strip with double-sided tape to form a circular rosette.

projects.finished_product_description: A circular paper rosette made by accordion folding a piece of paper and joining the ends.

steps.instruction: Create wheels by sticking buttons to card. Frill a piece of paper with an edge punch and glue across the middle of the circle as shown.
steps.visual_description: A hand gluing buttons onto a card circle, and a piece of paper with a frilled edge being glued across the middle.

steps.instruction: Tie a short piece of ribbon into a bow and stick it on for an extra flourish.

projects.name: Pillow Box

steps.instruction: Cut out the pillow box template.

steps.instruction: Score along all dashed lines.

steps.instruction: Fold the box along the scored lines.

steps.instruction: Assemble the box by tucking in the tabs.
steps.visual_description: The folded pillow box being closed.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Tuck the side tabs into the main body to form the box. The curved ends will fold inwards to close the box.

tips: Use a bone folder for crisp folds.
Add ribbon or twine through the end holes for a decorative closure.

templates.name: Layered papercut
templates.shape_description: The first template is an oval shape with a label 'Grey border (optional)' below it. The second template is an oval shape with leaves attached to the bottom-left side, labeled 'Lilac'. The third template is an oval shape with leaves attached to the top-right side, labeled 'Yellow'. The fourth template is an oval shape with leaves attached to the bottom-left side, labeled 'Pink'. The fifth template is an oval shape with leaves attached to the bottom-right side, labeled 'White'.

diagram_descriptions: A diagram showing five templates for a layered papercut project. The first template is a plain oval. The subsequent templates show variations of the oval with leaf elements attached at different positions and orientations, each labeled with a color: 'Grey border (optional)', 'Lilac', 'Yellow', 'Pink', and 'White'.

templates.name: Papercut variation
templates.shape_description: A circular outline with various decorative elements placed in different sections. The elements include a floral pattern in the top-left, a more abstract floral design in the top-right, leaves in the bottom-left, and a detailed flower in the bottom-right. One example shows a grey border around the circle.

diagram_descriptions: A grid of six squares, each containing a circular outline. The top-left square shows a decorative floral pattern filling the top-left quadrant of the circle. The top-right square shows a stylized, spiky floral design in the top-right quadrant. The middle-left square shows a cluster of leaves in the bottom-left quadrant. The middle-right square shows a detailed, layered flower in the bottom-right quadrant. The bottom-left square shows a cluster of leaves in the bottom-left quadrant. The bottom-right square shows a detailed, layered flower in the bottom-right quadrant. Text labels indicate 'Grey border', 'Pastel pink', 'Teal', 'Orange', and 'White' associated with different variations or colors.

templates.name: Oval papercut variation
templates.shape_description: An oval shape with different decorative elements on the top or bottom half, or a plain oval border.

diagram_descriptions: A grid of five oval outlines. The top row shows three variations: a plain oval border labeled 'Grey border', an oval with a floral design on the left side labeled 'Teal', and an oval with a scalloped design on the top right side labeled 'Pastel pink'. The bottom row shows two more variations: an oval with a leaf design on the bottom left side labeled 'Orange', and an oval with a floral design on the bottom right side labeled 'White'.
